website_summaries.verdict: A safe choice if you're looking for something non-toxic and non-corrosive.
cons: Some owners say it's not the ideal solution for asphalt cleanup
others have found success cleaning up driveway and garage floor stains

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works wow
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is pretty bad ass. I had 3 oil spots on the garage floor from the previous owner of our new house. Pressure washer alone did absolutely nothing. Poured some of this on the spots, agitated with a brush, let it sit for 5-10 minutes, then pressure washed them and they came almost entirely off. Did it 2 more times and they are 99% gone. Love this. Pic attached of the garage afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Ghozt

customer_reviews.title: Removed all stains on my driveway.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that it would really remove all the oil stains on my driveway from oil leaks, but it did. I didn't dilute it at all, just pour it over the stain, waited about a minute, then with my hose did a hard blast over the stain. All gone! Usually not even a trace of the stain left. A few times there was a small trace left that most people wouldn't notice at all, but I just re-did the same thing and the entire stain was gone.
customer_reviews.author: agoutimouse

customer_reviews.title: I see reviews that act like this stuff breaks the oil down immediately
customer_reviews.text: After so many positive reviews, I suspended disbelief and bought 3 gallons. However, it didn't make a dent in my driveway oil stains. I had oil stains in my driveway from a leaky car. Applied for at least 5 minutes. Scrubbed with a brush and kept adding the product to ensure concrete didn't dry out too quickly. I see reviews that act like this stuff breaks the oil down immediately. Well, the only difference I could tell was that my concrete and oil stains appeared wet after I applied this stuff. Then I washed it down, and let it dry. Absolutely no difference! Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This stuff really works.
customer_reviews.text: Great STRONG general purpose cleaner and especially de-greaser. Works the best of anything I have found for cleaning my garage floor. Great for underhood cleanup. Just spray on and rinse off, and watch the dirt/grease melt off and rinse away. Beware, this stuff is strong, it is hard on your hands and it will oxidize bare aluminum if allowed to stand on the aluminum surface. Good THOROUGH rinsing is REQUIRED to remove all traces of cleaner from surfaces, hands, etc. I have found nothing better. I gave it 3 stars for "scent".. it just smells soapy to me.
customer_reviews.author: Rainmaninwa

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that a safe de-greaser would be that best bet. Nope, appears not. I first mixed 10.5 oz in 2 gallons of water. after scrubbing with a stiff brush and 2 applications, it didn't do anything. So naturally, I used it without mixing it with water. Surely pure concentrate would removal oil off the driveway. Nope. I was hoping, but it didn't work. I will be asking for my money back.
customer_reviews.author: RogueM4

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I used this to remove oil stains ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used this to remove oil stains from my concrete driveway. How I applied this: I used a spray bottle for the solution and then sprayed it on the oil spots. Waited 15+- minutes or so before I scrubbed it with a wire brush. After scrubbing it good, rinse the area good with the water hose. Let it dry (Upon drying, if there are still some traces of oil stains that remains, just repeat the steps mentioned above). Some oil stains you may need to apply it 2 to 3 times before there will be no trace of it. Overall this is a great product and it did what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: May work well for other things, but did not work well on my oil spots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get oil out of concrete. I was going to buy some expensive enzyme powder specifically for that purpose, but this was less expensive so I figured I would try it first. I had four spots on the patio of various sizes. I'm not sure how long they've been there (they were there when I bought the house) or what kind of oil it was (synthetic, etc.) so those things may affect the results, but on one spot this product lightened it considerably and the other three spots it had no visible effect at all. It probably works very well as a general cleaner/degreaser, but it didn't work well for what I purchased it for.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hesse

customer_reviews.title: Removed old oil stains from driveway with ease.
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old oil stains were easily removed with very little scrubbing. I used it full strength which I'm sure is not recommended. Most impressive!
customer_reviews.author: VegasEve

customer_reviews.title: Miracle cleaner for anything greasy!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing - it cuts through that nasty greasy dust that collects on top of kitchen cabinets in literally seconds, just spray it on and wipe off the gunk instead of scrubbing for an hour with regular cleaner/degreaser or a magic eraser, etc. I’ve used it on carpets prior to shampooing, on oil stains in laundry, and on bathtubs with teenage-boy grime - all with fantastic results. Try it and you’ll always have a jug on hand too.
customer_reviews.author: Erica M.

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT remove oil stains from concrete
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is no more than concentrated household all purpose cleaner. I used it per the directions and cleaned the concrete literally dozens of times using a variety of brushes and techniques. In the end, it looks marginally lighter...not satisfied at all. I should have known better "OIL EATER"? not hardly. Not sure where all the great reviews come from. Save yourself the money and frustration and just use laundry soap. Photo 1 is day of cleaning. Photo 2 is next day.....
customer_reviews.author: XYZ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Really better than expected. Does a good job of removing old stains and deposits and breaking down greasy grime. Spray via a pump sprayer and keep wet for a few minutes (the longer the better) and rinse away with water (the hotter the better) and most things are down-to-the-metal clean. Nooks and crannies do need a little agitation from either a brush or some pressurized water. Old driveway stains are considerably lightened and again I was very impressed. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Montgomery Burns

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: I have not found that this has done anything better to remove grease stains from my new concrete than 409 or any other cleaner. After leaving on the stain for 24 hours - it dries long before that - the stain is still there. Yes - when you wipe it off initially it does remove the bulk of the grease - but the stain is still left behind. Not worth the price. I found that scrubbing with Simple Green and then putting a Oxy powder on the stain and wetting it works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: PKC

customer_reviews.title: Good product, lousy packing
customer_reviews.text: Definitely helps with cleaning massage sheets of rancid oil smell. Doesn't remove all older oil stains, though it does a reasonable job, especially for the price. Packaging... was flatly horribly lousy - it's a wonder it arrived. This is ONE GALLON of liquid product. Yellow paper/bubble envelope (13" x 17" ish) NOT sufficient. Arrived torn entirely open at the top (thin paper flap), multiple smaller holes in envelope, I could smell the product as I pulled it out of the post office box. (It appears to still be sealed, I haven't double-checked yet.) I like the product, and I'm still having serious second thoughts about ordering, again.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Took a nasty motor oil/transmission/power steering AND brake fluid stain that was over 1 year old i would say 90% away.. 1 more cleaning and should be gone for good! People that say it does not work are not using it correctly, soak the area and LET IT SOAK FOR 30 MINUTES... then lightly spray some water and a tiny bit more cleaner then SCRUB THE CRAP out of it! THATS IT.. STAIN GONE! Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Armando B.

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for cleaning concrete floors
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a pre-treatment before cleaning our concrete driveway and patio with a 3200 psi pressure washer. I dilute it with hot water at 2:1 or 3:1 depending on how dirty the concete is. After is sits for a few minutes I brush it with a stiff bristle push-broom. It foams up slightly while changing color to a dark orange-red while lifting dirt and grease. I find that (diluted) one-gallon can clean about 70-75 sq.M (750-800 sq.ft.). It is a little messy, but does help loosen the dirt and reduces the time required to pressure wash a driveway. Please remove the scum and filth, and clean things up. 86-45
customer_reviews.author: Lotus-SevenTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Wow...this stuff really works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean up troublesome oil spots that have been accumulating on our driveway. I have used other products in the past that claimed to do what this did for my concrete driveway. The bottle recommends diluting the solution prior to using it. I went ahead and applied the liquid straight from the bottle and used a bristle tooth broom to work it into the concrete. It cleaned up very quickly with a minimum of effort (compared to previous experiences with other products). To say that I am pleased would be an understatement, plus it comes in a gallon container, so I have plenty to share with family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Worked MUCH better than I expected! A great value as well.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for degreasing engine parts where I couldn't use more aggressive caustic chemicals i.e. soft aluminum. I also didn't want to use something in my back yard that was going to be toxic to animals or vegetation. Thought this was going to perform OK at most, was pleasantly surprised. Used it as a parts soak, and even diluted with water it loosened crusty deposits and varnish.
customer_reviews.author: M. Coon

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Was not expecting much out of this, especially with the price. When I opened the bottle I was disappointed, the product looks clear as water and as thin as water but with a somewhat pleasant smell such as a watered down Lysol. However when i tried it I was amazed, if you pour this and saturate the area where the oil is and scrub, it will make the oil look like melted chocolate and it will start coming off. Would buy it again, works well.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Great for carpet cleaning
customer_reviews.text: I used oil eater with my steam cleaner and loved the results. I sprayed it on my carpet, brushed it in with a straw broom and used my steam cleaner to rinse and extract the dirt and water and after it dried, i was dazzeled. A thorough rinse is a must though. I was able to get out spots that i never expected to remove when used straight from the bottle. Customer service was great when i needed the rstio of product to water.
customer_reviews.author: B. A.S

customer_reviews.title: Keep your expectations in check- concrete is not 100% clean
customer_reviews.text: A craigslist buyer's old Pathfinder dumped some oil on my mostly pristine concrete driveway. Then he drove through it...joy. The next day, I sprinkled some kitty litter on it, but there wasn't that much to absorb. A day later, I hit it with Simple Green Total Outdoor Cleaner and a very stiff brush on a long handle. That got the bulk of the oil up, but the "ghost" stain remained. Considering the high ratings, I thought this stuff would eliminate the rest. Nope. Looks pretty much like it did when I started, so I don't think it's much better than the Simple Green product.
customer_reviews.author: dcdude

customer_reviews.title: Works Good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Jegs bench top parts washer and was looking for a decent parts cleaning solution that didn't break the bank. I am used to using Stoddard solvent which, to me, is the flagship of parts cleaning solutions. It's also extremely expensive. I read the reviews on Oil Eater and thought I'd give it a try. I was impressed by it's ability to cut through. Being water based, it's pleasant to the nose and skin and it's also nonflammable. It's also very affordable as you can mix it with water at 50:50. I put some uncut in a spray bottle and pre-sprayed the parts I wanted to clean. It worked well to soften up the grime. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: psycho-billy-cadillac

customer_reviews.title: a big driveway oil stain is now minimal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for oil on driveway. It made a significant improvement to a huge oil stain. The oil had been consistently leaking for 8 months. Once I had the truck repaired to fix the leak, I bought this degreaser. I used it once with just a little improvement. I used it a second time about an hour later and saw significant improvement. Just a couple spots left, but plan to try it a couple more times. Overall a very big oil stain is now minimal. I did not dilute, poured it on, scrubbed a bit with a steel brush, and rinsed it off with hose. I was so pleased with it, I definitely wanted to leave a review.
customer_reviews.author: V. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: The Best all-purpose cleaner/degreaser you will ever need
customer_reviews.text: This is The Best all-purpose cleaning product I have ever used! Strong enough to use in pressure was hff er to get oil stains off your driveway, yet gentle enough to remove stains from clothing, too. Never rough on my skin, nor does it dry out my hands like some other strong cleaning products. Color is clear, and practically odorless, which is important to me because some chemicals/fragrances ccx an give me instant migraines. I've used it to clean my messy bbq grill, and sprayed in my shower to remove hard water and soap scum. Truly the best cleaner and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous for Laundry Stains.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this product. My primary use is for laundry stain pre treatment. I have used it for about 20 years and only ruined one T-shirt. A great grease remover too. Just use CAUTION and read the label before you go willy-nilly with this stuff. There is no residual fragrance either which is a real plus for me.
customer_reviews.author: keep it simple

customer_reviews.title: did not work so good for me..
customer_reviews.text: used this to try to clean a dirty BBQ grill.. it was quit ineffective against the accumulated grease and gunk.. used full strength left the solution on the gunk overnight... still not very useful.. after i cleaned the stuff off very quickly with oven cleaner.. i tried to use it to generally clean the outside of the stainless steel again dissapointed, left residue and stuff on the surface, again several attempts and same results.. the stainless was not cleaned very well.next time i will look elsewhere...
customer_reviews.author: radio100

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: While the sewer people were putting new sewer lines in they sprayed grease all over my door by accident. They paid for me to buy stuff to clean the door since they could not get the grease off and they tried many times. I checked out a lot of products and this seemed to be what I was looking for. And I was right. Just look at the pics. It is great and I will def buy it again!!! The pictures are sideways for some reason but you can see the before and after. Amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Hermanator

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but okay
customer_reviews.text: Used this to try to remove oil and road sludge from my new garage. It definitely removed the surface grime, but didn’t get rid of everything. For the money and something that doesn’t etch concrete, its not bad. I tried the recommended 1:1 dilution per the instructions. This was left on the concrete for 15 minutes with constant scrubbing with a shop broom. Rinse and repeat. The first round gave me pretty black water. The second time didn’t pick up anything, so I stopped there.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. E

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned grease stains from concrete
customer_reviews.text: My concrete patio had 10 or so grease stains from cooking on the BBQ. I poured some Oil Eater right on each stain, about 1-2” in diameter that had been there since last year. Then, I took a scrub brush and scrubbed the Oil Eater into each stain. Waited 10 minutes and then rinsed it off with a hose. When the concrete dried, no more stains. Plus there wasn’t any harmful fumes. I have so much of it leftover, so my next project will be the BBQ grill.
customer_reviews.author: shalia

customer_reviews.title: Eats up motor oil in an instant from a spill
customer_reviews.text: after accidentally spilling some motor oil on driveway, I bought this in hope of it working to clean the spill up. Well it worked excellently. Poured a little on the spill Let it sit for about 30 seconds Used a brook to brush it around for about another 30 seconds Hosed it away and viola the spill and oil stain were gone. Mind you the oil did sit for 3 days before I cleaned it as well. This is a great product
customer_reviews.author: ROB n VICKI

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for hard to clean oil gas stains on concrete
customer_reviews.text: I have very old oil stains and has stains in my garage Concrete floor. We used this today and power washed it. I was amazed how well it took the stains out. We def need to do a 2nd cleaning but it took 60% of the stains off. And the smell of dirty oil and gas is gone. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product for auto parts
customer_reviews.text: I've used all kinds of Simple Green, Purple Power, industrial cleaners, and solvents over the years to clean auto parts. This stuff is amazing. I left some parts that came off a 50 year old truck to soak overnight, and in the morning the tub was dark - a good sign. I pulled the parts out and they were almost completely grease-free. Light brushing with a nylon brush removed the rest. I would definitely recommend this product for cleaning parts.
customer_reviews.author: A. Nonymous

customer_reviews.title: It really does eat oil and grease!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! I have been using it for several years now. I do most of my own auto work where I get oil and grease on my work clothes and garage floor. I use 1 part oil eater to 1 part distilled water in a spray bottle. Soak the affected areas and the grease n oil is gone. I’ll let my nasty clothes sit for an hour in the washer after spraying all effected areas liberally before starting the cycle. Add generous amt. of detergent, oil eater to the bleach dispenser, soak cycle, extra rinse and boom, all gone!
customer_reviews.author: S. Cafarelli

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for car oil
customer_reviews.text: I must have received the diet version because it hardly lifted up any oil on my driveway. I used a 50/50 dilution as indicted and then full strength. It broke some of the oil down but the stain started to grow outward as I scrubbed it. Concrete can be porous but a $2 bottle of dish detergent worked much better. Maybe this is better suited to much smaller jobs but reconsider if you need it for a driveway.
customer_reviews.author: MatthewGB

customer_reviews.title: It works and that makes me feel good
customer_reviews.text: I used with out diluted it, I use it as it comes and I have great results washing the rims of my car after 10 years of not scrubbing my wheels . I used in the kitchen and it does removes and cleans the surfaces I sprayed. I gave this product 4 stars because I didn’t diluted and because I haven’t tested more than 5 times. Would I recommend, yes , it is cheaper than other degreasers and for me it worked better than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: carlos diaz

customer_reviews.title: Best degreaser I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I only recently discovered this stuff and as someone who does most of his own car work and bicycle work, I have seen my fair share of degreasers. This stuff is by far the best I have ever used. Love it and will likely be a lifelong customer!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Did a 90% Good Job
customer_reviews.text: I've used better and I've used worse. This product did a 90% job very quickly to remove oil, grease etc., from the driveway. However it did NOT get it all. And even rust stains were left. I can see light gray oil spots where the spots were the heaviest. Bottom line. It will get 90% of the oil and grease stains out... but I'm looking for a STRONG product which will penetrate the concrete and get out 99%!
customer_reviews.author: S_Richards

customer_reviews.title: Had no effect on oil stain
customer_reviews.text: I used this product on a power steering fluid stain on my driveway. Following the instructions, I applied the cleaner twice with little or no difference. The third time, I applied the cleaner and then covered the area with a towel and kept the towel moist in order to give the cleaner additional dwell time. Again, no difference. Any non-standard application suggestions would be appreciated if effective.
customer_reviews.author: T Schuh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work very well on concrete
customer_reviews.text: Tried using this for the second time on a velativility fresh oil drip from my car. The only thing it did was to get some of the oil that soap and a garden hose would remove. tried scrubbing then rinsing. After using this product i went back to try cat litter and mineral spirits which did a better job. I would not recommend this product for removing oil from concrete.
customer_reviews.author: arnoldtoolman

customer_reviews.title: Must have if you ...
customer_reviews.text: If you dealing / fixing with cars bikes boats and have another life about being and looking clean You must have this product, I do bartending and my hands must be clean, No product is getting oil and grease off my hands as quick as this product, it cleans almost any surface, I deal with bikes and just spraying wiping oil off has never been this easy ! Recommend
customer_reviews.author: caglar

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I could not believe how well this worked on concrete. I had oil stains on my driveway for 7 years and nothing would get them out. Then I tried this and think it is absolutely amazing. Buy it, it works!
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great I recently purchased 13 year old valve covers with caked motor oil/ carbon build up. I used a stiff tooth brush and this degreaser and it works better than most degreasers out there. I ended up scrubbing and sprayed the product about 3 x and would let the degreaser sit for about 2-5 mins in between and this was the final result. Overall happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Moises

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.  I didn’t use as directed.  Worked great after leaving on all nigh.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I read one of the other reviews and they said just to pour it straight on with no dilution. So that’s what I did. The next day look like it was worse until we sprayed it off with water and it completely disappeared. I wish I had taken before and after. I don’t even see where the stains were now.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Product had little to no effect on old garage floor stains
customer_reviews.text: Maybe the product works better on newer / fresher stains, but it did not work very well on the old stains on my garage floor. Even using at full strength, I estimate that the product only removed about 10% of the floor stains.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbycarll

customer_reviews.title: Incredible product
customer_reviews.text: I have a car detailing business and use a lot of Oil Eater as every vehicle has a engine detail, fist I spray the entire motor and compartment with the product then power spray, eliminates all the accumulation . What I really like is that European vehicles like the German vehicles have 20+inch rims that are black with brake dust, spray this on and 90% comes off with water spray.
customer_reviews.author: Lee North

customer_reviews.title: Works. 100%. Works on pavers.
customer_reviews.text: This works! Had 3 year old and accumulating oil stains from my 5.0 on my pavers. I applied full strength, scrubbed with a stiff bristle broom, misted the area with eater, scrubbed again, then rinsed. I reapeated this 3 times. The stubborn oil stain is gone. As soon as you start scrubbing. You see the brown oil muck lifting up from the surface. Awesome product. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: JAKE

customer_reviews.title: This cleaner works but..........
customer_reviews.text: This cleaner works but it takes a bit of patience. I used it to try and remove 10weight oil from an untreated concrete driveway. I followed the instructions on the label and got limited success. It takes perhaps a month and lots of scrubbing but it will remove 10weight oil from untreated concrete. YMMV depending on how saturated with oil the concrete is.
customer_reviews.author: ds0ocx

customer_reviews.title: Best degreaser. Period.
customer_reviews.text: I restore old BMWs. Nothing I've found does a better job of removing caked on grease from 30+ year old suspension and drive-train components. I put this stuff, un concentrated, in a spray bottle and spray on. Wait a few minutes, scrub some, and hose off. Rinse, repeat. See pics of before/after on the under side of my 1987 BMW 535is.
customer_reviews.author: cek

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: Have tried quite a few water based parts washer cleaners, and this brand excels in oil and grease removal from lawn mower parts. I use a 70% cleaner to 30% water in 3 1/2 parts washer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Totally wrong description and the product is useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought after reading so many positive review but it didn’t worked for me. I followed the instructions carefully and after putting so much effort and time nothing happened. Returning for refund
customer_reviews.author: Komal

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful product. Used it to degrease engine-- which helps ...
customer_reviews.text: Wish I'd known about Oil Eater a long time ago. ONE application eliminated a motor oil stain in driveway. That spot is now CLEANER than the driveway-- it works that well. No odor. What a wonderful product. Used it to degrease engine-- which helps car engine run cooler, save on gasoline usage. Looks near-new under the hood now. It doesn't have a "toxic feel" to it, which is also nice. Also been using it to DEGREASE my Dad's old rusty, greasy, oily tools (photo). You wouldn't BELIEVE the grime on stuff-- in minutes, the clear Oil Eater turns ORANGE! I love these old (now, CLEAN) tools! The BOMB. P.S. I tell EVERYONE about Oil Eater.
customer_reviews.author: FLowWOOLF NATURALS

customer_reviews.title: Dilute!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is my go to cleaner just remember to dilute it as per instructions. Removes oil from my garage floor, pet stains from the carpet, grease from the stove, Blood from the porch (don't ask). Takes a little scrubbing sometimes. If using a spray bottle do not inhale the mist, seems a little caustic. Rinse the concrete or it will etch if used in a high concentration. Awesome stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Top quality Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: We used this product to clean up the garage floor before applying the paint. We strictly follow the instruction on the can. 10 part water for one part cleaner. We poured it on the floor, and scrub it lightly. It worked wonderfully. All the dirt and grease were just gone as we rinsed off. We should have done this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Zebra

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as described
customer_reviews.text: Tried product straight out of the bottle on several quarter size oil spots in a small area on my cement driveway, Pored on and scrubbed with a very stiff push broom, scrubbed over and over even adding more of this item. After rinsing off with a hose, Oil spots are still there. Disappointed in product, Returned.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fahey

customer_reviews.title: This one works
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a home over 2 years ago with an insanely dark oil stain on the driveway. It was dark, old, and ugly. I have tried cat litter, TCP, other powders, oven cleaner, WD40, scrubbing like crazy, and nothing really worked. Maybe a slight difference but the spot was still very very visible. Got this in the mail today and dumped it all over the stain without diluting + a bristle brush broom, scrubbed it all around until bubbly and let it sit for about 20 - 30 minutes until dry. The difference is staggering. A few more rounds of this and I can confidently say that this stain will be so light that it will go totally unnoticed. Finally!
customer_reviews.author: Zach Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: THIS STUFF WORKS! Had an oil spill after changing oil in our 2 year old driveway. Wife was livid, cat litter didn't get all of the spilled oil up. I poured a 50/50 mix over the area and the oil nearly immediately came up. I let it soak for about 5 minutes and rinsed off and driveway cleaner than new!
customer_reviews.author: tjm6515

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: When I was a carpet cleaner, this was my go to for hard to get rid of stains. The scent is pleasant and not overpowering. A little goes a long way. I put a little less than half in a spray bottle, fill rest with water and use as a prespray with your Bissell or other brand carpet cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: ErinR

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised on all oils and grease
customer_reviews.text: Picked up a leaky project truck and it messed up driveway. Got this stuff after reading reviews and blown away at how well it took up diesel, axle and fuel from driveway. Couple spots needed a second soak and scrub but worked. Only downside was it turned a couple spots from Black (driveway color) to deep blue.
customer_reviews.author: R M

customer_reviews.title: Works Amazingly!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this along with the 32 oz spray bottle to use at our fair booth concessions for around the grills and fryers. Best product we have every used for instantly removing the grease and greasy buildup. Literally just spray on and wipe or rinse away. No scrubbing or scraping required! Great value for such and amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: sewglenda

customer_reviews.title: Significantly lighter but still there.
customer_reviews.text: I treated my pavers about 4 times at full strength for the oil stains to look significantly lighter. I scrubbed the very first time and then the next few times I just let it soak. I didn’t let it sit overnight like the other reviewer. I just left it for a few hrs until it dried up. I don’t think it would work after it dries so I usually hose it down after it has dried. It’s light enough now that the rest will fade over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So cheap for so large a bottle degrease concendtrate
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked by this item. So cheap for so large a bottle degrease concentrate. It can also be used for cleaning my car engine as well as other oily things at home.
customer_reviews.author: jcraohit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect in my parts washer
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for something a bit more environmentally friendly for my engine parts washer. This product not only smells great, and is safe to use, but its the best cleaner i have ever used for carburetors. i mixed it at a ratio of about 3 parts water to 1 part solution and it was almost magic! for the price you just cant beat this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hayward

customer_reviews.title: Significantly reduced motor oil stains
customer_reviews.text: This stuff did a better job than I expected. I had a huge oil spill on my patio from an oil change gone wrong on my BMW motorcycle. I didn't really give this stuff time to work that any bacterial type digestant needs. That said, it did a pretty good job and significantly reduced the staining. I hope to use it again this summer when the weather warms up and leave it on so I can really tell how good of a job it does.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tobin

customer_reviews.title: Used to love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: What Happened? I have used this stuff for years, I loved it. But this new container of Oil eater leaves the ground looking like I spilled even more oil on the ground, I had to get a hose and wash it off. I had some of the older oil eater left so I tried it and it was great, I just pour some on the oil spot and walk away days later you cant tell where it was. But the new stuff if worse than nothing. UPDATE well turns out this stuff is still great, they made it stronger so you need to add water soon after to get the results you want Just bought 5 gallon container
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Hadley

customer_reviews.title: Works great with stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: This is so awesome with stainless steel. I had hard time removing oil stain from backsplash tile, this didn't work on that. Also for exhaust, I used different product which had some acid in it but this worked great on stainless steel. I loved it. Giving 4 stars because didn't worked on backsplash tile well.
customer_reviews.author: Pals

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: I had contractors installing granite and one of their trucks was leaking oil badly. He parked on the street but after a 4 day install there were multiple spots and they were incredibly unsightly. I tried water which didn’t work. I found this product and I was incredibly skeptical that it would work. I used less than half a gallon and it completely removed all 5 spots. This stuff is bada$$ and incredibly inexpensive for what it did. 100% biodegradable too. Rad. I’m happy. I sent one to my father to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Keahistight

customer_reviews.title: I've tried several cleaners and nothing pulled the grease out of my crappy, un-sealed concrete
customer_reviews.text: ACTUALLY CLEANS UP CONCRETE WITH GREASE STAINS FROM GRILL. Takes a few weeks for it to work but this actually and truly works well!!!!!!! I can't even believe it. I've tried several cleaners and nothing pulled the grease out of my crappy, un-sealed concrete. My grill drips everywhere and there were drip marks everywhere. I poured some of this stuff on it with some water, scrubbed it in a bit and left it for a few weeks and forgot about it. Came back and all the grease spots were gone. awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Lemont

customer_reviews.title: Patience!
customer_reviews.text: We had long-term oil stains on our pavered driveway and had tried other products with no luck. The results were very satisfactory with Oil Eater although it does take patience and repeated applications. We hosed it down after each application, let it dry and then reapplied. The area treated was approx 4 x 4 ft and we had to purchase another 1 gallon of which we only used a small amount to make it disappear completely. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: nautica

customer_reviews.title: Magic product for bbq grease!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product! We had a huge mess from a bbq on concrete in the backyard. SO MUCH grease and more grease. We tried everything in our house to remove the stain. I decided to try this product and the concrete looks better than it ever has even before the stain! Now I bought more so we can wash the rest of the concrete to look brand new like where the stain used to be. Also the price is right. Very concentrated so we didnt use much. Used a hard brush to wash the concrete and the smell is like a lemon soap
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up most oils.
customer_reviews.text: Like the fact that this works to remove most oil and grease residue. It's the best cleaner that I've used so far. But I Have found out it does not remove the spray tacky oil that's used on motorcycle air filters. It is also a little irritating to my throat when I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Tri-Z

customer_reviews.title: Good for cleaning kitchen and bathtub.
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonders on my grimy white kitchen cabinets. I diluted it with water, sprayed and let it sit for about 5 minutes. Oil and dirt slid right off. I have never been able to get anything else to clean them. Same easy cleaning in my bathtub. It does have a strong chemical scent.
customer_reviews.author: Taya

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful cleaning product
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. Just pour 50/50 (degreaser/water) in a spray bottle, a scotch brite griddle polishing pad and paper towels. Spray on surface a few times, scrub and wipe with paper towel. Comes off pretty easily. Eye protection (glasses or goggles)and gloves recommended when doing this. For tough grease spots do this like 3 times to get clean. From now I'll only be using this product to clean my kitchen. A+++++
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia G. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Worked for my oil stains on concrete driveway.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use for driveway oil stains. I poured it undiluted and scrubbed with a kitchen sponge. Let it sit for a few days, then it rained and washed everything away. It didn't look pretty until it rained. I'm sure you could hose or power-wash it off to have it looking better immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: The best degreaser!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best cleaner/degreaser you can buy.. period! I love this stuff. they used to sell it at Costco, soi I was ecstatic when I found it here on Amazon for less!. I used this stuff to clean up a light tan colored carpet in my old Infiniti. It had oil stains, dirt, etc. This stuff cleaned it all up surprisingly well!! The leather was also dirty and dingy, too. and since it did such a great job on the carpet, I decided to try it out o the leather. and to my amazement, WOW!!!!! It looked BRAND NEW.. I was so impressed wit this stuff I had top write a review. Get this cleaner. you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred T.

customer_reviews.title: Takes off the Grime!
customer_reviews.text: Soaked some old rusted metal pieces that had years of oil, rust, and grime on them and this stuff allowed to to just wipe off. Works great when soaked and slightly diluted with warm water and a wire brush or hardy scrubbing brush. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product on the recommendation that it would easily clean/remove tire shine over spray stains from a concrete driveway. Mixed as directed, 1.6 cups per gallon of water. Wet area, spray, scrub, rinse. Really didn't do a thing. Stains remain.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Sipala

customer_reviews.title: Carefully Follow Directions
customer_reviews.text: Product was reasonably effective in removing old oil and grease stains from my garage floor. That being said, product is aggressive and can damage the concrete if not diluted or left on too long. Be careful with this product - Test the surface to be cleaned before tackling the entire garage floor.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Effective Value
customer_reviews.text: I have been using oil eater for many years, but it is not widely available in our area, so buying online at a great price is just what i needed. A very effective degreaser that I mostly use for automotive use. Slight solvent scent to it, but not so strong that I would rule out using it inside the house.
customer_reviews.author: T22

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Remove Car Oil From Concrete Floor
customer_reviews.text: Used to try to remove oil that leaked from a car onto a concrete driveway and garage floor. Some oil spots had been there for six months to a year, other only for an hour or two. applied and waited different times before scrubbing and trying to remove. Didn;t work at all. I think these products used to work good but now that they are environmentally friendly they just don't have the power. This product didn't eat any oil. Save your money ! The before and after looked the same. Used high power hose to wash off and it did nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Diana H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Used it to clean the transmission fluid from my concrete driveway. Had a large transmission stain on my driveway that was about 10 days old. Tried a couple of other products that did not work. The first time I diluted it to a 10 to 1 mixture. It did an ok job. The second time I mixed it about 40% Oil Eater and 60% hot water. After some rubbing with a stiff brush the stains came right off. It even lightened the older spots of oil on the driveway.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Tried it on both concrete and asphalt to remove old oil stains and hydraulic fluid spilled by a garbage truck in front of the house. This only somewhat mitigated the stain appearance. I wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: It works, but so will you...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff looks like water. It definitely works, BUT you will have to work HARD with it. With my old grease/oil grime, on the cement, it will take many days and many applications of this stuff. Lots of scrubbing, and waiting. It also causes the stain to spread out, inside the cement (the stain grows.) Expect LOTS of work.
customer_reviews.author: IR

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely WORTHLESS a waste of time and money. False advertising I put it on some peanut oil in my shop and it did ABSOLUTELY nothing.
customer_reviews.author: William M.

customer_reviews.title: Cleans oil spills well
customer_reviews.text: Used this last night to help clean up a large, accidental oil spill in my driveway. I tried a dry sweep product just prior to this, and that didn't really work well. For this spill, I used it at full concentration, pouring it straight onto the spill. I then scrubbed it with a stiff bristled broom, and hosed off. A couple of "rinse and repeat," and the stain is nearly gone. Seems to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought and expense oil stain remover that worked great, but for $12(12oz) it only covered about 2"x2' of area. This was a gallon for $17 bucks and it worked fine, you just had to use a old towel to rub it out-no big problem. It has a nice smell and really gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: sonya glassen

customer_reviews.title: Good oil cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a great grease and oil cleaner. Used on asphalt driveway. Takes a few applications (depending on how much oil there is) but does a reasonable job. Not 100% (yet) but I doubt anything will be that easy--then everyone would use. Also worked great on cleaning microwave and oven. Have not tried on clothes or other stuff, but will not hesitate to try. Also, the run off from driveway applications have not yet seemed to do any damage to the grass/growth around the area, so it seems to be pretty safe. Recommending. I bought two gallon bottles and am glad to have the extra.
customer_reviews.author: RTICH

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for fresh oil stain on concrete
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that I purchased this product and had to try and scrub really hard and no oil came out of the concrete pad. Product does not work as claimed it would. Maybe it’s good to overall clean but it did not work for me for what I needed it to
customer_reviews.author: Aura

customer_reviews.title: Multiple uses besides cleaning concrete
customer_reviews.text: I like to walk bare foot - my feet get very dirty and I thought I would never get my tub clean (not ceramic) works great - highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Mustang

customer_reviews.title: Does not work, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Does not work. Put the product on an oil stain that was 2 days old. Left it sitting so it would seep in and take care of the oil stain. Took a power washer to it. After waiting for it to dry, turns out the stain is the same as it was before. Did absolutely nothing to remove it
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Destroys Oil
customer_reviews.text: Destroys Oil... dump some on concrete that had stains in my driveway. Let it sit for a little bit sprayed it off. Did an amazing job of removing oil. Did not get every single bit of it the first time but you could tell how it emulsifys the oil and pulls it out of the concrete
customer_reviews.author: David Banner

customer_reviews.title: you need to brush it into the surface
customer_reviews.text: I used a stiff broom to work it into the concrete. Really cleaned up the garage floor, but I had to do it more than once. For stubborn stains I used it full strength. For normal grime it works okay diluted, per instructions on the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: I was blown away!
customer_reviews.text: If you need a product that will allow you to get engine components incredibly clean this this is it! I was pleasantly surprised with the results!! Highly recommended as a safe degreaser.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Works like a charm! To the guy who got ticked off and left a 1 star review about this product ruining the parts under his hood: One of the very first things the warning label says is “remove immediately from anything aluminum”. This product corroded your alternator because the housing is made of aluminum. Read the instructions!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel G.

customer_reviews.title: Better then all other and non toxic.
customer_reviews.text: I give it 4 because I had get down and dirty and scrub. But worked better then any other degreser I used before. Highly recommend leaving it soaked for several hours and using a high pressure gun. If I had a pressure gun I would have had not needed to scrub.
customer_reviews.author: sadiq ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and they satisfied me so I purchased this product to remove baby oil stains in my driveway. It did nothing for the stain however, it did remove other dirt spots pretty well. Was not happy with the outcome. Easy to use but did not do my job.
customer_reviews.author: Danita

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning anything
customer_reviews.text: Great for cleaning anything. But the real reason I purchased it was because it is great at removing the oils from Poison Ivy, Poison Oak and Poison Sumac from my hands so it does't spread on my body. I'm not a big fan of wearing gloves while gardening, so when I'm working out in the yard every 20 minutes to 1/2 hour I wash my hands with Oil Eater and when I'm finished gardening I wash all my tools with it and throw the clothes I'm wearing in the wash and use it in there too. So far this summer no out breaks of Poison Ivy, Oak or Sumac!
customer_reviews.author: booklover

customer_reviews.title: Did not Remove driveway stain
customer_reviews.text: I have an oil stain on my driveway from something leaking from my car. I tried several things to remove the oil with no luck. When I used this product, I poured it on and let it sit for about 15 minutes. Right away I could see some of the oil float to the top. After 15 minutes, I used that jet setting on the hose to wash away. The stain is a bit lighter, but unfortunately it is still there.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: It's like magic!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! We had 5 year old motor oil in the garage floor but this stuff made it seem like there was nothing ever there. Very easy to clean and use, I recommend scraping the oil with a grout spatula or old credit card before brushing to make the procces easier if it's a thick layer. I love it so much I've recommended it to all my friends! Also a bonus it's great for use in the kitchen distilled with water in a spray bottle cuts through cooking grease with ease
customer_reviews.author: Tannia A.

customer_reviews.title: This did nothing for me
customer_reviews.text: I put it on several oil stains under my car from my radiator leaking and bringing dirt and oil with it from the engine. I put it under power steering fluid stains and it only made the clean concrete turn a little white around the edges. Oil stain on their own did not removed.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Glad I tried it!
customer_reviews.text: Being "food safe' and not a strong chemical, I was very hesitant to try this in my parts washer. I gave it a shot, mixed it 3:1 in the parts washer and I can honestly say, I will probably never buy any other de-greaser in my life. This stuff is awesome. I am completely blown away at how well it works!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. I had spilled a quart of used oil on my garage floor. Product definitely cleaned up the oil residue and lightened the stain but there’s still a ghost stain that I’ll probably need a poultice to draw out completely. I applied full strength and used a stiff bristle brush for a total of 3 applications. I also finished my cleaning attempt with my pressure washer. It was cheap so I can’t complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

product_meta.title: Oil Eater Original 1 Gallon Cleaner/Degreaser
product_meta.description: Cleaner Degreaser, Water-Based, Container Size 1 Gal, Color Clear Yellowish, Removes Grease, Oil, Dirt and Grime, Standards California South Coast Air Quality Control and USDA Approved.
feature_bullets: Safely dissolves grease and oils on most everything, product contains no acids, abrasive or petroleum solvents and is water based and biodegradable so safe for all uses even in septic systems
Non-toxic, non-corrosive, non-hazardous, USDA approved for non-food surfaces, call the toll free help line for professional cleaning advice
Concentrated product, use dilution chart on each bottle to achieve maximum product performance and value
Household uses: Laundry precept, floors, carpets, tub/tile, grills, decks, asphalt and concrete driveways, stoves, boat hulls, white wall tires, siding and more
Industrial uses: Engines, machinery, floor scrubbers, tools, pressure washers, parts washing, exhaust hoods, and more, used in restaurants, quick lubes, garages, production facilities, HVAC and more
Just add water for the perfect light and medium and heavy duty cleaner

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,068 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
